title.narrative: Schools Promoting Learning Achievements through Sanitation and Hygiene (SPLASH)

description.narrative: SPLSH works within the mini and tries to strenthen the existing systems at scale using systems approach that creates or strebgthens relationships among partners and stakeholders to increase reach and impact. The first tree years will do intensive infr and systems development while in the final year will use a light touch apporoach to finalise implementation and consolidate operation and mantainance. Use small doable action approach i.e encourage schools on the waiting list to use local and simple. Establish or reeforce infrastructure within a supply and mantainace system that will promote long term solutions. Will engage multiple partners such as NGOs, USAID partners and also strengtheing local private sector to achieve sustainablity.

The main target group group for SPLASH are learners in the targetted schools with a special emphssis on school going girls. The secondary beneficiaries are the teachers, surrounding communities and the ministry of education.

to improve health, learning and educational performance of basic school children and their teachers by improving sustainable access to safe water, adequate sanitation, and by adopting better hygiene and health practices in targeted schools and communities
